title: CocoPack Ecosystem
text: Want good starter kit setting new R script? Copy / paste snippet enjoy! Want best best modeling? Include following well: (Though note brms rather intensive package install. Well worth , though, .)
code: if (!require(pacman)) {install.packages("pacman")} pacman::p_load('this.path', 'aqm', 'scales', 'psych', 'RColorBrewer', 'viridis',                 'cowplot', 'patchwork', 'ggstatsplot', 'ggforce', 'ggh4x',                 'ggpubr', 'ggridges', 'ggrepel', 'ggExtra', 'rstatix', 'tidytext', 'glue', 'tidyverse') pacman::p_load('brms') # the only modeling package you'll ever need

title: CocoPack Ecosystem
text: listified version many packages, ’ve found particularly useful data scientist researcher (cognitive science + NeuroAI): tidyverse: opinion, -end-, hands-GOAT ecosystem packages data manipulation, visualization, modeling. reticulate: package integrating R Python. citr: package managing citations RMarkdown documents. tinytex: package managing LaTeX distributions engines. boomer: package inspecting data processing pipelines.

title: CocoPack Ecosystem
text: Tools working ggplot2 find almost always loading: Intuitive specification plot layout operators + /. Example: plot_grid() get_legend() facet_nested() force_panel_sizes() facetted_pos_scales() element_markdown() geom_richtext() geom_mark_hull() radial_trans() geom_bspline() reorder_within() scale_{x,y}_reordered() ggsummarystats() stat_cor() stat_compare_means() ggstatsplot: package publication-ready plots statistical details. ggeasy: package simplifying common ggplot2 design + theme management. ggside: package adding side panels ggplot2 plots. ggridges: package creating ridgeline plots. ggrepel: package adding labeled text ggplot2 plots. ggExtra: package adding ggMarginal() plots. ggstance: Horizontal ggplot2 (now deprecated favor base ggplot2). ggfortify: Expanded autoplot functionality ggplot2.
code: design <- " AABB AABB AACC " p1 + p2 / p3 + plot_layout(design = design)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Colin Conwell. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Conwell C (2025). cocopack: Utility Functions Data Analysis Visualization. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {cocopack: Utility Functions for Data Analysis and Visualization},   author = {Colin Conwell},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

what: Utility Functions for Data Analysis and Visualization
title: Utility Functions for Data Analysis and Visualization
text: Miscellaneous, tidy-style quality--life convenience functions development R, inspired packages like Hmisc. Caveat Emptor: Much documentation package product custom auto-documentation tool (coming soon!) ’ve written ample help Claude Sonnet 3.5. code code ’ve used tested, documentation may always fully accurate.

title: Utility Functions for Data Analysis and Visualization
text: can install development version CocoPack GitHub : , load usual library('cocopack')… alongside packages withpacman:
code: if (!require(devtools)) {install.packages("devtools")} devtools::install_github("colinconwell/CocoPack-R") if (!require([pacman])) {install.packages("pacman")} pacman::p_load('cocopack', 'dplyr', 'ggplot2')

title: Utility Functions for Data Analysis and Visualization
code: # Bootstrap analysis with stats parsing results <- run_bootstrap(   data_frame = your_data,   group_vars = c("group1", "group2"),   boot_fn = your_function,   times = 1000 )  # Spearman correlation with bootstrap cor_results <- spearman_boot(   df = your_data,   x_var = "variable1",   y_var = "variable2",   group_vars = c("group"),   R = 1000 )  # Add significance labels results <- label_significance(results, p_col = "p", alpha = 0.05)

title: Utility Functions for Data Analysis and Visualization
text: Helpful functions data manipulation:
code: # flip mapping keys and values mapping <- list(a=1, b=2, c=3, d=4, e=5) flip_names(mapping)  # Slice a vector like dplyr::slice() # with python-style indexing: vector <- c('a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e') vslice(vector, start, stop=NULL)  # Read CSV and add filename as a column df <- read_csv_add_name("path/to/your/file.csv")

title: Utility Functions for Data Analysis and Visualization
text: Helper functions plotting ggplot2:
code: # View all ggplot2 shapes view_ggplot2_shapes()  # Legends with less margin plot + closer_legend()

title: Utility Functions for Data Analysis and Visualization
text: diy/ directory contains helpful resources package development: README.md: Comprehensive guide R package development pipeline build.qmd: Step--step Quarto document building package hexicon.R: Script generating package’s hexagonal logo / sticker

title: Utility Functions for Data Analysis and Visualization
text: build process documented diy/build.qmd includes: Documentation generation Package integrity checks Description file management Remote installation options Example usage hex sticker generator: diy/hexicon.R

title: Utility Functions for Data Analysis and Visualization
text: Contributions welcome! Please feel free submit Pull Request. major changes, please open issue first discuss like change.

title: Utility Functions for Data Analysis and Visualization
text: Please report bugs issues GitHub issues page.

what: Add Log() to Variable Names — add_log_to_name
title: Add Log() to Variable Names — add_log_to_name
text: Adds log transformation notation variable names, removing existing 'log' 'Log' tags present

title: Add Log() to Variable Names — add_log_to_name
code: add_log_to_name(x, check = TRUE)

title: Add Log() to Variable Names — add_log_to_name
text: x Character string representing variable name check Logical, TRUE adds log notation 'log' 'Log' already present

title: Add Log() to Variable Names — add_log_to_name
text: Character string log transformation notation

what: Add a Closer Legend to ggplot — closer_legend
title: Add a Closer Legend to ggplot — closer_legend
text: Modifies legend position margins place closer plot area default ggplot2 spacing.

title: Add a Closer Legend to ggplot — closer_legend
code: closer_legend(position = "bottom")

title: Add a Closer Legend to ggplot — closer_legend
text: position Character string specifying legend position ('bottom', 'top', etc.)

title: Add a Closer Legend to ggplot — closer_legend
text: ggplot2 theme object modifies legend positioning

what: Create a Custom ggplot2 Theme — cocopack_theme
title: Create a Custom ggplot2 Theme — cocopack_theme
text: CocoPack themes ggplot2.

title: Create a Custom ggplot2 Theme — cocopack_theme
code: cocopack_theme(which = "default", text_size = 16)

title: Create a Custom ggplot2 Theme — cocopack_theme
text: Character string specifying theme variant. Currently 'default' supported. text_size Numeric value base text size theme. Default 16.

title: Create a Custom ggplot2 Theme — cocopack_theme
text: ggplot2 theme object

title: Create a Custom ggplot2 Theme — cocopack_theme
text: default theme minimalist theme based theme_bw() gridlines removed.

title: Flip Keys and Values in a Named Vector or List — flip_names
code: flip_names(mapping)

title: Flip Keys and Values in a Named Vector or List — flip_names
text: mapping named vector list names swapped values

title: Flip Keys and Values in a Named Vector or List — flip_names
text: named vector list keys values flipped, preserving original class

title: Label Statistical Significance — label_significance
text: Label Statistical Significance

title: Label Statistical Significance — label_significance
code: label_significance(   results,   p_col = "p",   alpha = 0.05,   label_values = c(0.001, 0.01, 0.05),   ns_label = "NS" )

title: Label Statistical Significance — label_significance
text: results Results data frame p_col Column name containing p-values alpha Significance threshold label_values Vector p-value cutpoints label ns_label Label non-significant results

title: Label Statistical Significance — label_significance
text: Data frame added significance labels

what: Load a Dataframe from any File Format — load_data
title: Load a Dataframe from any File Format — load_data
text: Loads data various file formats including CSV, Excel, Parquet, RDS files. Can handle single file path multiple file paths.

title: Load a Dataframe from any File Format — load_data
code: load_data(   file_path,   file_type = NULL,   sheet = NULL,   add_path_col = FALSE,   path_col_name = "file_path",   ... )

title: Load a Dataframe from any File Format — load_data
text: file_path Character string character vector path(s) file(s) file_type Optional character string specifying file type. NULL (default), function detect file type file extension. sheet Optional sheet name number Excel files (default first sheet) add_path_col Logical, TRUE adds column file path (default: FALSE) path_col_name Character string specifying name path column (default: "file_path") ... Additional parameters passed underlying read function

title: Load a Dataframe from any File Format — load_data
text: single dataframe one file path provided, combined dataframe multiple paths provided

text: file_path Character string character vector path(s) file(s) file_type Optional character string specifying file type. NULL (default), function detect file type file extension. sheet Optional sheet name number Excel files (default first sheet) add_path_col Logical, TRUE adds column file path (default: FALSE) path_col_name Character string specifying name path column (default: "file_path") ... Additional parameters passed underlying read function

title: Run Bootstrap Analysis — run_bootstrap
text: Performs bootstrap analysis grouped data progress bar

title: Run Bootstrap Analysis — run_bootstrap
code: run_bootstrap(   data_frame,   group_vars,   boot_fn,   times = 1000,   hypothesis = 0,   parse = TRUE,   simplify = TRUE )

title: Run Bootstrap Analysis — run_bootstrap
text: data_frame Input data frame group_vars Vector grouping variables boot_fn Bootstrap function apply times Number bootstrap iterations hypothesis Null hypothesis value parse Whether parse results summary statistics simplify Whether return simplified results

text: Data frame bootstrap results

title: Spearman Correlation with Bootstrap — spearman_boot
text: Spearman Correlation Bootstrap

title: Spearman Correlation with Bootstrap — spearman_boot
